Package voltage.core

Class VoltageDigitalCounter

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageComponent
voltage.core.VoltageDigitalCounter
public class VoltageDigitalCounter
extends VoltageComponent
A class to show a digital clock type display. Set a number/digit directly or set the different digital lines directly with flags.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  VoltageDigitalCounter.Flags
    Individual flags for the digital readout - OR these together
    static class  VoltageDigitalCounter.Justification
    Justification of the numbers within the control.

  • Constructor Details

    • VoltageDigitalCounter

      public VoltageDigitalCounter​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String displayName, VoltageModule module, int numDigits)
      Create a digital counter object.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the control.
      displayName - the display name of the control.
      module - the module this should belong to.
      numDigits - the number of digits to show. Use SetValue() and GetValue() to set the number. Alternatively, you can set the specific bar lines using SetBarsForDigit()
      See Also:
      VoltageComponent.SetValue(double), VoltageComponent.GetValue()

    • VoltageDigitalCounter

      public VoltageDigitalCounter​(java.lang.String name, VoltageModule module, int numDigits)
      Create a digital counter object.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the control.
      module - the module this should belong to.
      numDigits - the number of digits to show. Use SetValue() and GetValue() to set the number. Alternatively, you can set the specific bar lines using SetBarsForDigit()
      See Also:
      VoltageComponent.SetValue(double), VoltageComponent.GetValue()
